intro: Gentiana nudicaulis subsp. ting-nung-hoae, commonly known as the Ting-nung Hoae gentian, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family, characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude meadows and rocky habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its slender stems and small, showy flowers make it a distinctive member of its genus. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
